definition: false name/pseudonym/alias/pen name/the Japanese kana scripts/hiragana 平假名[ping2 jia3 ming2] and katakana 片假名[pian4 jia3 ming2]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: First, please study Hiragana and Katakana.
sentences.chinese: 首先，请学习平假名和片假名。

sentences.english: First, please study Hiragana and Katakana.
sentences.chinese: 首先，请学习平假名和片假名。

sentences.english: And a survey suggests that youll be perfectly willing to admit that its not the real thing.
sentences.chinese: 一项调查表明，你会很乐意地承认自己买的是假名牌。

sentences.english: The thief gxdye a false name to the police.
sentences.chinese: 小偷给警察报了个假名字。

sentences.english: He checked in at the hotel under a false name.
sentences.chinese: 他用假名字登记住进了旅馆。

sentences.english: Pseudonymity is the use of pseudonyms as identifiers.
sentences.chinese: 假名性是将假名作为标志符的用法。

sentences.english: Pseudonymity is the use of pseudonyms as identifiers.
sentences.chinese: 假名性是将假名作为标志符的用法。

sentences.english: Sorry I use hiragana. I never study kanji.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉我用平假名，我从没学过日文汉字。

sentences.english: Kierkegaard wrote the book under a series of false names, or pseudonyms.
sentences.chinese: 克尔凯郭尔写这本书下了一系列的假名，或用假名。

sentences.english: Kierkegaard wrote the book under a series of false names, or pseudonyms.
sentences.chinese: 克尔凯郭尔写这本书下了一系列的假名，或用假名。

sentences.english: Down with the United Fucking States of America!
sentences.chinese: 片假名，美国，就是这么发音的。

sentences.english: The resulting designs were then called "hiaragana".
sentences.chinese: 设计的结果就是后来被称为“平假名”。

sentences.english: If someone misbehaves, hiding behind a pseudonym does not protect [them].
sentences.chinese: 如果有人有不法行为的话，假名保护不了他们。

sentences.english: For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width.
sentences.chinese: 例如，日语片假名字符可以写为全角或半角形式。

sentences.english: Server aliases will be compared with multidrop addresses by IP address.
sentences.chinese: 服务器假名将通过IP地址与多分支地址比较。

definition: reading or phonetic value of a character
honorific (e.g. in grammar of oriental languages)
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
